definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: The mule was frightened and ran away, kicking wildly.
sentences.chinese: 骡子惊恐不已，疯狂地踢动着跑开。

sentences.english: I am breathing in Thy answers, Stilling every doubt and fear.
sentences.chinese: 我今呼入你的答复，平静疑惑和惊恐。

sentences.english: Melinda and Steve looked up fearfully when Veach walked in.
sentences.chinese: 维克走进屋时，梅林达和史蒂夫惊恐地抬起头来。

sentences.english: Once they saw us, they were still panicking.
sentences.chinese: 他们看见我们仍然很惊恐。

sentences.english: The horrified Philistines gave a shout of terror.
sentences.chinese: 惊恐的腓利士人发出可怕的叫声。

sentences.english: To her horror, she saw him fall.
sentences.chinese: 她看见他跌下惊恐万状。

sentences.english: Some central bankers will shudder at the thought.
sentences.chinese: 一些央行将对该想法感到惊恐。

sentences.english: He was filled with astonishment at seeing the dead body.
sentences.chinese: 他看见尸体时惊恐万状。

sentences.english: However, sach a cooperation aroused fear and hostility of the United States and other Western powers.
sentences.chinese: 同时也引起了美国等西方大国的惊恐和敌视。

sentences.english: Love is when she grips your arm during the scary bits of the movie.
sentences.chinese: 爱是当她看到惊恐的剧情时不自禁地抓着你的手。

sentences.english: They are alarmed at the prospect of the war.
sentences.chinese: 他们对战争的前景感到惊恐不安。

sentences.english: They were alarmed by a sudden attack .
sentences.chinese: 他们因受到突然袭击而惊恐不安。

sentences.english: In most cases fearis a healthy reaction to a dangerous situation.
sentences.chinese: 惊恐大都是对危险倩况的一种积极反应。

sentences.english: Fright drained all colour from his face.
" She looked at me in horror. "Are you crazy?
sentences.chinese: 可是她却面带惊恐地看着我，“你疯了吗？”

sentences.english: I succumbed to the frightening and was hardly in lull .
sentences.chinese: 惊恐完全慑服了我，使我几乎麻痹。

definition: to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
